intro: Secamone brachystigma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with four to five petals, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
